Name: Hathor - cow
Description: This limestone figurine comes from the excavations of E. Naville and H. Hall at Deir el-Bahari. It depicts the goddess Hathor in the form of a cow painted in yellow. The piece, which was probably a votive work, belongs to the images of the goddess as the protectress of the Theban necropolis. It particularly underlines her primordial role in the cycle of the regeneration of the dead.
